intro: Tachigali rigida, commonly known as the rigid tachigali, is a small to medium-sized tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with a pinnate structure, and its flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences. Tachigali rigida produces pods that contain seeds, and it is often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological systems in its native habitat.
